intro: Quiina nitens, commonly known as the yellow quina, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance. Quiina nitens is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system and drought-resistant features.
